Detailed Description

A database Connection class.

Member Enumeration Documentation

◆ OpenMode

enum storage::ittiadb::Connection::OpenMode

An enum Open mode How to handle the possible prior existence of the database.

Enumerator
OpenExisting 

Open the database, which must already exist.

OpenAlways 

Open the database, creating it if necessary.

CreateAlways 

Create an empty database, replacing an existing database if necessary.

CreateNew 

Create an empty database, which must not already exist.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

◆ Connection() [1/2]

storage::ittiadb::Connection::Connection ( )

Construct a default connection.

The connection URI must be supplied when the connection is opened.

◆ Connection() [2/2]

storage::ittiadb::Connection::Connection ( const char *  uri__)
explicit

Set the location of a local or remote database.

Parameters
uri__Database file name or remote URL, in one of the following forms:
  • "[path/]example.db"
  • "idb+tcp://server[:port]/[path/]example.db"
  • "idb+shm://[share-name]/[path/]example.db"

Member Function Documentation

◆ open() [1/6]

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Connection::open ( Connection::OpenMode  open_mode)
inline

Open a connection to a new or existing file storage database.

Parameters
open_modeDatabase open mode
  • OpenExisting Open the database, which must already exist.
  • OpenAlways Open the database, creating it if necessary.
  • CreateAlways Create an empty database, replacing an existing database if necessary.
  • CreateNew Create an empty database, which must not already exist.
Returns
  • DB_OK When successful.

  • DB_FAIL On failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Open mode not set correctly or Configuration parameter is null.
    • DB_EEXIST CREATE_NEW prevents overwriting an existing database.
    • DB_EACCESS File exists and is read-only or in case of memory config, Memory storage exists and is already open by another connection.
    • DB_EOSERROR The file is otherwise unreadable.
    • DB_ESOCKETCONNECTION A connection to the server cannot be established (IPC client only.)
    • DB_ESOCKETHOSTNAME The given host name cannot be resolved (IPC client only.)
    • DB_ESTORAGE Storage cannot be created due to invalid configuration.

◆ open() [2/6]

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Connection::open ( Connection::OpenMode  open_mode,
const db_file_storage_config_t &  config 
)
inline

Open a connection to a new or existing file storage database.

Parameters
open_modeDatabase open mode
  • OpenExisting Open the database, which must already exist.
  • OpenAlways Open the database, creating it if necessary.
  • CreateAlways Create an empty database, replacing an existing database if necessary.
  • CreateNew Create an empty database, which must not already exist.
configFile-based storage configuration
Returns
  • DB_OK When successful.

  • DB_FAIL On failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Open mode not set correctly or Configuration parameter is null.
    • DB_EEXIST CREATE_NEW prevents overwriting an existing database.
    • DB_EACCESS File exists and is read-only or in case of memory config, Memory storage exists and is already open by another connection.
    • DB_EOSERROR The file is otherwise unreadable.
    • DB_ESOCKETCONNECTION A connection to the server cannot be established (IPC client only.)
    • DB_ESOCKETHOSTNAME The given host name cannot be resolved (IPC client only.)
    • DB_ESTORAGE Storage cannot be created due to invalid configuration.

◆ close()

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Connection::close ( int  flags = 0)

Close the database connection.

Parameters
flagsReserved for future use, set to zero.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid database handle or parameter.
    • DB_ELOCKED A transaction is still active in another thread. The database will not be closed in this case.
    • DB_ESOCKETSEND
Note
Could not send shutdown command to server.The connection to the server has been closed. (IPC client only)

◆ remove() [1/2]

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Connection::remove ( )
inline

Remove the database, destroying its contents and any associated files.

Precondition
The database has no open connections.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

Parameters

◆ set_lock_timeout()

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Connection::set_lock_timeout ( db_wtime_t  timeout)
inline

Set the timeout for distributed transaction and synchronous replication commit operations.

Parameters
timeoutTimeout duration in msec
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.
Note
The commit timeout is the length of time that a slave or peer database will wait after it has been instructed to prepare its transaction.If it is not instructed to commit before the timeout elapses, it will roll back instead so that other connections can continue using the database.

◆ stat_bufmgr()

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Connection::stat_bufmgr ( db_bufmgr_stat_t &  statistics) const
inline

Obtain buffer manager statistics.

Parameters
statisticsReturned buffer manager statistics.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid database handle or buffer manager statistics is null.

◆ event_watcher()

TableWatcher & storage::ittiadb::Connection::event_watcher ( const db_objname_t *  table_name)

Get the event watcher for a table on this connection. The returned object will be valid until the connection is closed.

Returns

◆ event_wait()

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Connection::event_wait ( db_wtime_t  timeout = 0)

Wait for a single change notification event and, if an event occurs before the timeout expires, call any registered event handlers for the corresponding table.

This function is safe to call from other threads while the connection is open. Do not call this function if the connection might be closed.

Parameters
timeoutevent wait timeout value
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure. On failure, one of the following error codes is set:
    • DB_ELOCKED When no notification event occurs within the timeout period.
    • DB_EINVAL Invalid database handle.
Note
isOpen is not thread-safe.

◆ event_dispatch()

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Connection::event_dispatch ( )

Dispatch all pending change notification events.

This function is safe to call from other threads while the connection is open. Do not call this function if the connection might be closed.

Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid database handle.
Note
isOpen is not thread-safe.

◆ event_listen()

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Connection::event_listen ( bool  enable)

Listen for change notification events in all threads.

Parameters
enable
  • true Enables Event listening
  • false Disables event listening
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

◆ backup() [1/2]

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Connection::backup ( const char *  backup_file_name,
uint32_t  file_mode 
)
inline

Copy a database to an unencrypted backup file.

Parameters
backup_file_nameDestination file name.
file_modeFile mode flags for destination file.

Create a backup database file and an associated log file. Both files are required to restore the backup. Open the database file created by db_backup normally to apply the log file.

This function returns only when the backup is complete. Other connections to the same database are not interrupted, and can read and write changes safely.

When connected to an ITTIA DB server, the backup file location location is relative to the server process.

Only disk tables are copied. A memory table must be copied to a disk table prior to the backup to include its contents in the backup file.

The backup files will not be encrypted, even if the original database is encrypted.

◆ backup() [2/2]

template<size_t N, typename T >
db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Connection::backup ( const char *  backup_file_name,
uint32_t  file_mode,
uint32_t  cipher_type,
const T(&)  cipher_key[N] 
)
inline

Copy a database to an encrypted backup file.

Parameters
backup_file_nameDestination file name.
file_modeFile mode flags for destination file.
cipher_typeType of encryption for backup files.
cipher_keyEncryption key for backup files.

Create a backup database file and an associated log file. Both files are required to restore the backup. Open the database file created by db_backup normally to apply the log file.

This function returns only when the backup is complete. Other connections to the same database are not interrupted, and can read and write changes safely.

When connected to an ITTIA DB server, the backup file location location is relative to the server process.

Only disk tables are copied. A memory table must be copied to a disk table prior to the backup to include its contents in the backup file.

The backup files will be encrypted with cipher_key.

◆ set_access_password()

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Connection::set_access_password ( const char *  password)
inline

Set a storage password.

Parameters
passwordPassword string.

The password is saved in the storage. Subsequent attempts to open the same storage will fail unless the same password is supplied through authorization credentials.
